decks.notes: The main idea of this Mono Black Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's hand and board with discard spells like Thoughtseize and Duress, while also removing threats with cards like Fatal Push and Sheoldred's Edict. The deck also aims to control the game with powerful creatures like Bloodletter of Aclazotz and Graveyard Trespasser, as well as utilizing resources like Mutavault and Castle Locthwain to outvalue the opponent. The deck's win condition includes using cards like Reckoner Bankbuster and Unstoppable Slasher to finish off the opponent.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's resources while maintaining board presence with creatures like Bloodletter of Aclazotz and Unstoppable Slasher. It utilizes hand disruption spells like Duress and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat help deal with threats efficiently. The deck also has ways to recur creatures with Sheoldred's Edict and Invoke Despair. The inclusion of cards like Unholy Annex/Ritual Chamber and Graveyard Trespasser adds an extra layer of graveyard interaction. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent and grind out a win through attrition.

This deck focuses on disrupting and controlling the opponent's game plan through a combination of removal spells like Go for the Throat and Heartless Act, hand disruption with Duress and Thoughtseize, and powerful creatures like Archfiend of the Dross. The deck also utilizes the Unholy Annex / Ritual Chamber enchantments to further control the board and generate value. The mana base is designed to support the color requirements of the spells and creatures in the deck while providing some versatility with creature lands like Mutavault.

The focus of this deck is to utilize the Transmogrify combo to cheat out powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Hidetsugu Consumes All. The goal is to control the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize while setting up the combo pieces. Jegantha, the Wellspring serves as a companion for additional value. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Duress and Bitter Triumph to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The mana base is designed to support the combo with a mix of dual lands and utility lands.

This deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with spells to bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard multiple times during a game. By using cards like Ledger Shredder and Picklock Prankster to discard cards, as well as spells like Consider and Opt to dig for more spells, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a steady stream of hasty flying threats. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Spell Pierce and Fiery Impulse to control the board while fueling the graveyard for Arclight Phoenix recursion.

This deck focuses on aggressive play, utilizing low-cost creatures with abilities that can quickly deal damage to the opponent. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds an extra layer of strategy. With a mix of fast creatures, burn spells, and disruption, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and close out the game quickly. The mana base is designed to support both red and black spells, with a mix of dual lands and utility lands to ensure consistency in casting spells each turn.

The main concept of this Red Deck Wins Pioneer 1 vs 1 deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly deal damage and secure a victory. The deck focuses on playing low-cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage, coupled with efficient burn spells like Wizard's Lightning and Play with Fire. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds flexibility and additional resources to maintain pressure on the opponent. Overall, the strategy revolves around fast-paced aggression and efficient removal to take down the opponent swiftly.

This deck focuses on building a board presence quickly with efficient creature plays, utilizing mana dorks like Llanowar Elves and Elvish Mystic to ramp into strong threats like Skyclave Apparition and Archon of Emeria. Thalia, Guardian of Thraben helps to disrupt the opponent's strategy while Aven Interrupter and Anointed Peacekeeper provide additional aggression and protection. Collected Company allows for explosive plays by searching for additional creatures. The deck's mana base is designed to support its aggressive strategy, with a mixture of dual lands and utility lands like Eiganjo, Seat of the Empire and Shefet Dunes.

This control deck focuses on utilizing Enigmatic Incarnation to continuously tutor for powerful creatures while disrupting the opponent's game plan. The deck features a variety of creatures with varying abilities to provide versatility in different matchups. The inclusion of the companion, Yorion, Sky Nomad, allows for additional card advantage and flexibility in gameplay. The deck also includes a mix of removal spells, land tutors, and enchantments to control the board and create advantageous board states. Overall, the key strategy is to outvalue the opponent and control the game until victory is achieved.

This Pioneer 1 vs 1 Goblins deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy. By playing low-cost creatures and burn spells like Atarka's Command and Play with Fire, the deck aims to quickly build a board presence and deal direct damage to the opponent. Cards like Legion Loyalist and Reckless Bushwhacker provide additional damage boosts to push through defenses, while Skirk Prospector helps ramp up mana for explosive plays. With a mix of efficient creatures and powerful burn spells, this deck seeks to rush down opponents before they can establish their own game plan.

This deck focuses on quickly casting spells to trigger the Arclight Phoenix's ability, allowing it to return from the graveyard to the battlefield. Utilizing a mix of low-cost spells and card draw, the deck aims to maintain a steady flow of spells to continually bring back the Phoenix and apply pressure on the opponent. With a balance of removal spells, counterspells, and card draw, this aggro deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of fast-paced gameplay and powerful creatures.

This goblin aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming opponents with a swarm of goblin creatures, utilizing cards like Cacophony Scamp, Battle Cry Goblin, and Goblin Chainwhirler to deal damage efficiently. The deck also includes ways to control the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat. Cavern of Souls ensures goblin spells can't be countered, while Call of the Death-Dweller allows for creature recursion. Overall, this deck aims to outpace opponents and maintain pressure with a relentless onslaught of goblin creatures.

The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent through a combination of sacrificing creatures to gain value and disruption spells to control the board. By utilizing cards like Witch's Oven and Cauldron Familiar, the deck can generate consistent incremental advantage while also utilizing cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Garruk, Unleashed to provide additional threats and close out the game quickly. With a mix of efficient creatures and disruptive spells, the Golgari Aggro deck aims to apply constant pressure and outvalue the opponent.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Duress, while also removing threats on the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Vanishing Verse. The deck also has a strong card advantage engine with Mazemind Tome and Unholy Annex/Ritual Chamber. The win condition of the deck revolves around powerful creatures like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Archfiend of the Dross, supported by synergy with cards like Unstoppable Slasher and Bloodletter of Aclazotz. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and provide both utility and consistency.

This deck focuses on fast, aggressive creatures and burn spells to deal quick damage to the opponent. The main strategy is to disrupt the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Duress, while controlling the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat. The creatures in the deck are powerful threats that can close out the game quickly, with cards like Archfiend of the Dross and Bonecrusher Giant providing both offense and defense. The mana base is optimized for consistent casting of spells and creatures, ensuring a smooth and aggressive gameplay experience.

The main focus of this UW Control deck is to maintain control of the game through a combination of counterspells, removal, and card advantage. By utilizing cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Memory Deluge, the deck aims to outvalue opponents while denying them the opportunity to execute their game plan. Shark Typhoon provides a win condition that can quickly close out games, while Strict Proctor and Get Lost help disrupt opponent's strategies. Overall, the deck aims to control the game until it can establish a dominant board presence and secure victory.

The main idea of this Rakdos Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Emberheart Challenger, supported by spells like Monstrous Rage and Ancestral Anger. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Thoughtseize to control the opponent's hand. With a focus on dealing damage quickly and efficiently, this deck aims to pressure the opponent and finish the game before they have a chance to stabilize. Additionally, the inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion provides additional synergy and consistency to the deck.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells, aiming to quickly reduce their life total to zero. The deck includes efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Callous Sell-Sword, along with powerful burn spells like Fatal Push and Monstrous Rage. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion allows for extra mana ramp and flexibility. The deck aims to apply constant pressure on the opponent and finish the game quickly before they have a chance to stabilize.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand and board with cards like Duress, Thoughtseize, and removal spells like Go for the Throat and Fatal Push. It also utilizes a combination of powerful creatures like Archfiend of the Dross and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse to control the battlefield. The deck's win condition revolves around using Fable of the Mirror-Breaker to create a massive board presence and overwhelming the opponent with creatures like Bloodletter of Aclazotz and Unstoppable Slasher. The mana base is designed to support the deck's heavy black requirements and includes utility lands like Castle Locthwain and Mutavault.

This deck focuses on quick and aggressive creatures, removal spells, and disruptive hand disruption to pressure the opponent and control the game. With a mix of creatures like Bloodtithe Harvester and Unstoppable Slasher, along with removal like Fatal Push and Torch the Tower, the deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total. Additionally, cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Thoughtseize help disrupt the opponent's game plan, giving this Rakdos Aggro deck the tools it needs to come out on top in a fast-paced Pioneer 1 vs 1 matchup.

The deck focuses on aggressive creatures with powerful effects to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. It includes a mix of efficient removal spells and hand disruption to maintain pressure and eliminate threats. The mana base is constructed to support the aggressive game plan while also providing flexibility for the deck's powerful late-game threats. Overall, the deck aims to quickly establish a dominant board presence and close out the game before the opponent can mount a defense.

This deck is focused on aggressive plays and putting pressure on the opponent early in the game. It includes a variety of powerful creatures like Bloodtithe Harvester, Bonecrusher Giant, and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse, along with removal spells like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize to control the board. The deck also features some disruptive elements like Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger and Liliana of the Veil to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Overall, the deck aims to win quickly through aggressive creature attacks and efficient removal spells.

This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and disruption spells. By using efficient threats like Bloodtithe Harvester and Archfiend of the Dross, along with removal spells like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize, it can quickly put pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Unholy Annex / Ritual Chamber provide additional ways to grind out value and finish off the opponent. The mana base is built to support the aggressive game plan with a mix of Swamps, dual lands, and creature lands.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells to deal damage efficiently. The key concept of this deck is to maintain pressure on the opponent from the early game by playing low-cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Emberheart Challenger, supported by burn spells like Fatal Push and Reckless Rage. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds an additional layer of consistency to the deck's strategy, allowing for a strong and aggressive game plan in every match.

This aggressive Rakdos deck focuses on quick and efficient creature damage, using cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Kumano Faces Kakkazan to apply pressure early on. The deck also includes cards like Fatal Push and Ancestral Anger to deal with opponent's threats and protect your own creatures. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds an additional layer of versatility to the deck. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and relentless assault, utilizing a combination of creatures, burn spells, and combat tricks to secure victory.

The focus of this Rakdos Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive creatures, using cards like Heartfire Hero, Monastery Swiftspear, and Emberheart Challenger. The deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently, utilizing spells like Turn Inside Out and Ancestral Anger to boost the power of its creatures. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds an extra layer of consistency to the deck. By applying pressure early on and maintaining a strong board presence, this deck looks to secure victory before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

The deck focuses on putting pressure on the opponent early in the game with efficient creatures like Aven Interrupter, Skyclave Apparition, and Archon of Emeria. It also aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Elite Spellbinder. The deck's mana base supports a fast start with Elvish Mystic and Llanowar Elves, while also providing flexibility with lands like Eiganjo, Seat of the Empire and Boseiju, Who Endures. Collected Company helps to maintain card advantage and keep the pressure up on the opponent.

The deck focuses on using the Transmogrify combo to cheat powerful creatures onto the battlefield quickly, while also disrupting the opponent's hand with discard spells like Thoughtseize and Duress. A key card in the deck is Atraxa, Grand Unifier, which can provide additional value by proliferating counters. The deck also includes removal spells like Fatal Push and Torch the Tower to deal with threats, as well as the companion Jegantha, the Wellspring for additional mana generation. Overall, the strategy revolves around controlling the board and quickly assembling a powerful board presence through the combo.

The deck focuses on using Transmogrify to cheat out powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Hidetsugu Consumes All. It also includes disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Duress to control the opponent's hand, while utilizing removal like Fatal Push and Torch the Tower to deal with threats. The deck's win condition revolves around assembling key pieces like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Case of the Stashed Skeleton to create a powerful board state and overwhelm the opponent. Jegantha, the Wellspring serves as a companion to provide additional value and flexibility in deckbuilding.

The deck focuses on using Transmogrify to cheat out powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Reckoner Bankbuster. It also includes various removal spells like Fatal Push and Torch the Tower to control the board. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds consistency to the deck. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats. It also includes hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Duress to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck is designed to be proactive and aggressive.

The deck focuses on using Transmogrify to cheat out powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Reckoner Bankbuster. With the help of Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Case of the Stashed Skeleton, the deck aims to set up its combo pieces efficiently. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion provides additional value and consistency to the deck. The deck also includes removal spells like Fatal Push and Torch the Tower to control the board, along with disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Duress. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by countering opponent's spells, removing threats, and drawing cards to maintain advantage. The goal is to maintain board control with a mix of removal spells, counterspells, and powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria. The deck aims to out-value the opponent by drawing cards and generating card advantage while controlling the board with removal spells like Supreme Verdict and Dovin's Veto. The mana base is built to support the control elements of the deck, allowing for consistent casting of spells while also providing utility lands for additional benefits.

This UW Control deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan by countering key spells, removing threats, and drawing extra cards with spells like Memory Deluge. Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and The Wandering Emperor provide card advantage and board control, while Supreme Verdict serves as a sweeper against aggressive decks. The deck also includes utility lands like Field of Ruin and Deserted Beach to handle problematic non-basic lands. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and win through attrition.

The primary strategy of this UW Control deck is to maintain control of the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Dovin's Veto and Settle the Wreckage, while also generating card advantage with Memory Deluge and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria. Shark Typhoon provides a win condition and The Wandering Emperor adds additional control elements. With a mix of removal, counterspells, card draw, and finishers, this deck seeks to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent in a grindy matchup.
